intro: Pavetta tetramera, commonly known as the four-merous pavetta, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are often consumed by birds and other animals. Pavetta tetramera is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and thickets.
